text:
this + <https://app-eu1.HubSpot.com/product-updates/26608090/in-beta?query=api>

the product updates are also a very good way to get new realeses + you can opt into  BETAs of New updated API Versions etc. <@U04HSBLHAJZ>

Hey Everyone!

Does anyone know <https://app-eu1.HubSpot.com/product-updates/26608090/all?update=13958397> in this Token Security Beta.

> Once a token is identified by GitHub (learn more about secret scanning) we'll receive an alert and automatically deactivate the token and regenerate a new one if possible. The impacted account and its associated administrators will receive an email notification with further instructions and links to remediate.
> See documentation for more information.
It will deactive the token which means that any workflows who have the old token won't work anymore correct?

so if i am the only one who has expertise with this and i am on holiday systems are pretty much down where custom code is integrated? or?

<@UV23JHEJY> would u say thats its still worth to get or more of a hassle to be when it goes off falsely?
<@U046C9LKJP8> here's the new vid on this from <@U02227D27V3>. It's excellent: <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QJGykk-z-YI>

Hi Team! Have a question regard of `hs_searchable_calculated_*` mentioned on <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/guides/api/crm/search>
Following this description I should be able to use calculated property
But this pattern is not correct, in reality it's following
```'mobilephone' => 'hs_searchable_calculated_mobile_number',
'phone' => 'hs_searchable_calculated_phone_number',```
May I know if there is a specific named calculated property for standard property `fax`?
And also this description is confusing, I'd prefer if you change it to follow real behavior.
Thank you in advance :blush:

Hi team!
Can someone please confirm if HubSpot supports this?
"We will use a HubSpot API to register a webhook URL in HubSpot account ( not the developer app ) and subscribe to events to get notified of different operations that happens in the HubSpot account"

If it is already discussed in a forum somewhere, please point me to it!

Thanks!
Yes, You can use private APPs in HubSpot.

*Hi Everyone,*
We attempted to enroll a contact in a sequence using APIs, but we received the following response. However, when performed manually, it works correctly.
_*Error: Failed to enroll contact in sequence. User 10510312 for Portal 7540009 has no connected inboxes, which are required to enroll via the public API.*_

Thanks
We are having the same issue! HubSpot support chat are useless and tell me to buy paid support
and that it's an issue on our end :rolls_eyes:
<@U074M1G3CG4> who are you in contact with?
